summary: The text discusses the prophecy about the destruction of Jerusalem and the temple. It notes that this prediction is true generally for the final judgment when all will be destroyed, as referenced in passages from Matthew and Revelation, and specifically for the destruction of Jerusalem by Titus and Vespasian 42 years after the passion of Christ. It highlights that this period was intended to allow for repentance per 2 Peter 3, but due to the hardened unbelief of the Jews, the destruction occurred to prevent a return to the old ways. The text reflects on the rejection of sacrifices and traditional practices after the coming of Christ, as noted in Isaiah 1.
